definition: to agree/to consent/to be ready (to do sth)/willing

sentences.english: McKinsey, which usually contorts itself to stay out of the news, became a headline regular.
sentences.chinese: 一向遠離新聞焦點的麥肯錫成爲頭條常客。

sentences.english: A version of this article originally appeared in The McKinsey Quarterly.
sentences.chinese: 本篇文章的另一個版本最先出現在《麥肯錫季刊》上。

sentences.english: The report bolsters the results of another survey, published by McKinsey last month.
sentences.chinese: 這份報告支持另一個麥肯錫上個月公佈的調研的結果。

sentences.english: McKinsey has put Mr. Kumar on an indefinite leave of absence.
sentences.chinese: 麥肯錫已經要求庫馬爾無限期休假。

sentences.english: Dr. Alex Peng is a partner at McKinsery & Company's Beijing Office. Dr.
sentences.chinese: 彭壯壯博士是麥肯錫公司全球董事，長駐北京。

sentences.english: McKinsey's psychological hold on its clients actually beggars belief.
sentences.chinese: 實際上，麥肯錫對客戶心理的掌控力之強讓人費解。

sentences.english: At the beginning of Gorman's career, he worked as a consultant at McKinsey & Co.
sentences.chinese: 戈爾曼的職業生涯起點是在麥肯錫擔任諮詢顧問。

sentences.english: “You can hire McKinsey to do that for you,” says one.
sentences.chinese: 其中一位說道，“你可以僱傭麥肯錫去幫你做這些”。
